channel.title: Donator Tokens
channel.description: I was wondering. I have added a item "Donator Token" to take the position of Donator Points on my server, and I was wondering how I would add the Donator Token as a currency, for example like "this item costs 1 donator token" or if you try to buy anything it says like "You don't have enough donator tokens to afford this item" How would I do this?

item.title: Donator Tokens
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

lol space:

I’m not that new. You just say " add this method " don’t state where exactly to put it. Like seriously.

Methods don’t really have an exact place they need to be added, just not in another method.
Also I did say a general area to put it

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:5, topic:537019”]It’d all be done in the same file as you’re editing. Find int getSpecialItemValue
Should look like:

public int getSpecialItemValue(int itemID){//It could be private, and the int name inside the parans. can differ.
     switch(itemID){//This name will be the same as above.
     case 1235://Item ID
          return 120;//How much it's worth.
     case 1235://Item ID
          return 120;//How much it's worth.
     case 1235://Item ID
          return 120;//How much it's worth.
     case 1235://Item ID
          return 120;//How much it's worth.
     case 1235://Item ID
          return 120;//How much it's worth.
     case 1235://Item ID
          return 120;//How much it's worth.
     case 1235://Item ID
          return 120;//How much it's worth.
     }
}

Now obviously it won’t be that ‘exactly’ but similar.

Above that one, or below it really doesn’t matter where this goes, as long as it isn’t in another method.

You make basically the same thing, but with a different name.

private int getCreditValue(int itemId){ switch(itemId){ case 1: return 200; } }
It’s not hard.[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Donator Tokens
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“lol space, post:9, topic:537058”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=655874.msg4390014#msg4390014 date=1387131006]

I’m not spoonfeeding but all is handled in Shoppingassistant.java and i am assuming you are using PI.

Make a new currency method. ig.) private int getDonatorToken(int id) { switch (id) { case 1050: //ItemId return 200; //the cost of donator tickets

Okay, so that doesn’t work just doesn’t recognize DonatorToken at all
Help pleas…

Did you not read the link I gave you?

When I followed the thing you made, it just gives me errors -.- help me on skype? Treven.Baileyy

My code is not meant for you to follow step by step. It is to guide you.
[/quote]
Well, i’m relatively new with coding so I don’t know what I’m doing .[/quote]
http://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/reallybigindex.html
have fun

Read full topic
